#labels Featured,Phase-Design
=Use Cases=

For quality assurance, starting from the soon to be release version 1.8.0 of the metalmouth extension, all of the following basic use cases must be able to be completed without issue (on Windows and Mac) before a new version of the metalmouth extension can be considered to be acceptable for public release.   This document is incomplete and will be added to shortly, and updated over time.

----
==1) Installation of packaged metalmouth extension==

===1.1) Installation from Project metalmouth website===

Precondition(s):
  # Chrome browser installed.

Action(s):
  # Download / install extension from Project metalmouth website (http://code.google.com/p/metalmouth/downloads/list).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Extension is listed in chrome://extensions.
  # metalmouth icon button is added into toolbar.  The icon shows a closed mouth.

===1.2) Installation from Chrome Web Store===

Precondition(s):
  # Chrome browser installed.

Action(s):
  # Download / install extension from Project metalmouth page on Chrome Web Store (https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/bmogbhmnbehfapbmjlaoflagfobahfli).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Extension is listed in chrome://extensions/.
  # metalmouth icon button is added into toolbar.  The icon shows a closed mouth.

----
==2) Starting metalmouth extension==

===2.1) Omnibox method===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.  
  # Chrome's omnibox has focus (to be certain use shortcut to focus the omnibox. Windows / Linux: Ctrl+L or Mac: ⌘-L).

Action(s): 
  # Press the 'm' key twice.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth extension should start with the words "metalmouth extension starting".
  # metalmouth extension button icon should change from having a closed mouth to an open mouth.

===2.2) Metalmouth button method===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.  

Action(s): 
  # Click the metalmouth icon button in the toolbar.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth extension should start with the words "metalmouth extension starting".
  # metalmouth extension button icon should change from having a closed mouth to an open mouth.

----
==3) Tab-level interaction==

Window shortcuts - http://www.google.com/support/chrome/bin/static.py?page=guide.cs&guide=25799&topic=28650
Mac shortcuts - http://www.google.com/support/chrome/bin/static.py?page=guide.cs&guide=25799&topic=28651&

===3.1) Create new tab===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
 
Action(s):
  # Create a new tab using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+T or Mac: ⌘-T).

Expected outcome(s):
  # New tab is create.
  # Focus changes to new tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Opening new tab (tab number) showing (url)".
  
===3.2) Close current tab===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
 
Action(s):
  # Close the current tab (selected) using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+W or Mac: ⌘-W).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Current tab is closed.
  # Focus changes to an open tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Closing tab (tab number) moving focus to tab (tab number) showing (url)".

===3.3) Cycle through open tabs===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
 
Action(s):
  # Cycle from the current tab (selected) to another open tab using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+Tab or Mac: Ctrl-Tab).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Focus changes to another open tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Moving focus to tab (tab number) showing (url)".

==4) metalmouth menu bar==

===4.1) Open metalmouth menu bar===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
 
Action(s):
  # Press tab.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth has stopped reading all items.
  # metalmouth "Top menu" is visible.
  # metalmouth should say "Top menu entered".
  # metalmouth should say "Change location button" has focus.

===4.2) Close metalmouth menu bar using esc===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
  # Tab has been pressed.
  # metalmouth has stopped reading all items.
  # metalmouth top menu is visible.
  # metalmouth should say "Top menu entered".
  # metalmouth should say "Change location button" has focus.

Action(s):
  # Press esc.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth "Top menu" is invisible.
  # metalmouth should say "Top menu closed".
  # metalmouth should say "Navigation mode entered".

===4.3) Close metalmouth menu bar using close button===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
  # Tab has been pressed.
  # metalmouth has stopped reading all items.
  # metalmouth top menu is visible.
  # metalmouth should say "Top menu entered".
  # metalmouth should say "Change location button" has focus.

Action(s):
  # Press tab until "close menu" button is focused.
  # Press enter.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth "Top menu" is invisible.
  # metalmouth should say "Top menu closed".
  # metalmouth should say "Navigation mode entered".

===4.4) Open change location menu===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
  # Tab has been pressed.
  # metalmouth has stopped reading all items.
  # metalmouth top menu is visible.
  # metalmouth should say "Top menu entered".
  # metalmouth should say "Change location button" has focus.

Action(s):
  # Press enter.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth "Top menu" is invisible.
  # "Change location menu" is visible.
  # metalmouth should say "Change location menu entered".
  # metalmouth should say "Back button has focus".

===4.5) Open metalmouth options===

  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
  # Tab has been pressed.
  # metalmouth has stopped reading all items.
  # metalmouth top menu is visible.
  # metalmouth should say "Top menu entered".
  # metalmouth should say "Change location button" has focus.

Action(s):
  # Press tab until "options" button is focused.
  # Press enter.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth "Top menu" is invisible.
  # Current tab should be re-directed to options page.
  # metalmouth should say "metalmouth voice browser options".
  # metalmouth should say "Reading all items".

==8) metalmouth options==

===8.1) New tab url option===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # metalmouth options page has been opened via metalmouth toolbar option - see previous use case "4.5) Open metalmouth options".
 
Action(s):
  # Press down arrow until "New tab url" text input box has focus.
  # Press enter to interact with the "New tab url" text input box.
  # The text input interaction area is now visible.
  # The text input area is focused.
  # Type in "http://www.google.co.uk".
  # Press tab until the "enter" button is focused.
  # Press enter. 

Expected outcome(s):
  # The text input interaction area is invisible.
  # "http://www.google.co.uk" has appeared in the "new tab url" text input box.

===8.2) Speech Rate Option===

====8.2.1) Available on Windows====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # metalmouth options page has been opened via metalmouth toolbar option - see previous use case "4.5) Open metalmouth options".
  # The speech rate range input box is available.
 
Action(s):
  # Press down arrow until "Speech rate" range input box has focus.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth should say "speech rate range input current value 0.9".

====8.2.2) Not available on Mac====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # metalmouth options page has been opened via metalmouth toolbar option - see previous use case "4.5) Open metalmouth options".
 
Action(s):
  # Use in-tab navigation to move down to "speech rate" option.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth should say "Option disabled etc...".

====8.2.3) Selecting====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # metalmouth options page has been opened via metalmouth toolbar option - see previous use case "4.5) Open metalmouth options".
 
Action(s):
  # Press down arrow until "Speech rate" range input box has focus.
  # Press enter to interact with the "Speech rate" range input box.
  # The range input interaction area is now visible.
  # metalmouth should say "increase value button has focus".  
  # Press enter. 
  # metalmouth should say "Value to enter increased to 1.1".
  # Press down arrow until "Enter button" has focus.
  # Press enter.

Expected outcome(s):
  # The range input interaction area is now invisible.
  # metalmouth should say "range input menu closed".
  # metalmouth should say "navigation mode entered".
  # The value of the speech rate range input is increased to 1.1.

Precondition(s):

Action(s):
  # Use in-tab navigation to move down to "Always-on" checkbox.

Expected outcome(s):
  # The checkbox input interaction area is now invisible.

Expected outcome(s):

===8.5) Saving Options===

====8.5.1) Save & Close====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # metalmouth options page has been opened via metalmouth toolbar option - see previous use case "4.5) Open metalmouth options".
  # A url value has been entered into the "new tab page" text box.
  # Speech rate has been selected.
  # Always-on has been checked.
  # Voice input has been checked.  
 
Action(s):
  # Use in-tab navigation to move down to "Save & Close" button.
  # Press enter to click on the "Save & Close" button.

Expected outcome(s):
  # The options page should close.
  # metalmouth should say "Closing tab (tab number)".
  # Focus changes to an open tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Moving focus to tab (tab number) showing (url)".

====8.5.2) Confirming option(s) are saved====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # metalmouth options page has been opened via metalmouth toolbar option - see previous use case "4.5) Open metalmouth options".
 
Action(s):
  # Use in-tab navigation to move down to "new tab page" text input box.
  # Then use in-tab navigation to move down to "Speech Rate" range input box.
  # Then use in-tab navigation to move down to "Always-on" checkbox.
  # Then use in-tab navigation to move down to "Voice input" checkbox.

Expected outcome(s):
  # When the "New tab page" text input box is focused metalmouth should say "new tab page text input box current value http://www.google.co.uk".
  # When the "Speech rate" range input box is focused metalmouth should say "".
  # When the "Always-on" checkbox is focused metalmouth should say "".
  # When the "Speech rate" checkbox is focused metalmouth should say "".

==11) Always-On==

===11.1) Try to turn off extension using omnibox method===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # The "always-on" option has been selected.
  # The options page has been saved and closed, using the save & close button.
 
Action(s):
